result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry G Laguna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment, and after care and domestic violence counseling. No contact with wife until after domestic violence training is complete and then there is to be no violent contact.  May go to restaurants that serve alcohol but must not drink any. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: **AMENDED 7-25-2016:  Huber privileges are granted for treatment.**

ALONG WITH $8,000.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH SULEMA MATTISON, DOB 02-22-1932 WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 940.235(1)-Strangulation/Suffocation; Ct 2: 940.19(1)-Battery; Cts 3 & 4: 947.01(1)-DC. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, PS (person, property, residence or family).    Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Defendant must reside with Sulema Mattison and may have absolutely no contact, direcly or indirectly, with the victim.

Defendant Larry G Laguna in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Larry G Laguna in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Rebecca Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for Co-signature bond with Sulema Mattison. Deft's wife is asking for no contact order to be lifted. The State objects citing concerns that if the offense is alcohol related or if the deft has issues with alcohol with the holidays coming, there could be additional issues between the defendant and victim. The Court conducts colloquy with Sulema Mattison, 2-22-32 regarding co-signature bond. Ms. Mattison indicates deft can stay in her home.

BTC: Bond modification is granted; $2000.00 cash, $8000.00 to be co-signed with Sulema Mattison, 02-22-1932, with photo ID. All conditions previously ordered remain and the Court orders additional conditions: SCRAM, must reside with Ms. Mattison, no contact, whatsoever with the victim
